long.am,ar,bg,bn,ca,cs,da,de,el,en,en_AU,en_G:
Text and Image Replacer Extension

The Text and Image Replacer Extension is a versatile tool designed to enhance your browsing experience by allowing you to replace any text and images on a webpage with your own selected content. Whether you want to personalize web pages, have some fun by swapping out content, or conduct unique experiments, this extension provides a simple and efficient way to customize your web browsing.

Features:
Replace Text: Easily replace all instances of specific words or phrases on a webpage with your chosen text.

Replace Images: Swap out all images on a webpage with an image of your choice. Simply upload an image, and watch as it replaces the existing ones.

Customizable: Choose exactly what text and images you want to replace, providing complete control over your web content.

User-Friendly Interface: The extension boasts a straightforward and intuitive interface, making it easy for users of all levels to customize their browsing experience.

Fun and Practical: Great for fun, creative projects, or even productivity by replacing distracting content with motivational quotes and images.

Lightweight and Fast: Designed to be efficient without slowing down your browsing experience.

How to Use:

Install the Extension: Add the Text and Image Replacer Extension to your Chrome browser from the Chrome Web Store.

Open the Extension: Click on the extension icon in your toolbar to open the control panel.

Upload Your Image: Select an image from your computer that you want to use for replacing existing images.

Enter Your Text: Type in the text you want to use for replacing existing text.
Activate the Replacement: Click the “Start Replacing Text + Images” button to apply your changes to the current webpage.
Stop the Replacement: If you want to revert to the original content, simply click the “Stop Replacing Text + Images” button.
Ideal For:

Web Designers and Developers: Test how different text and images look on a webpage without making permanent changes.

Educators and Students: Create customized educational content for better engagement and learning experiences.

Content Creators: Mock-up how your content will appear on live websites.
Entertainment: Have fun by replacing text and images to create amusing and creative web pages.
